definition: gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

sentences.english: Objective To study the nursing points of using semiconductor laser to cure early glottis cancer.
sentences.chinese: 目的探討半導體激光手術治療早期聲門癌的護理要點。

sentences.english: Hiccup is a brief involuntary inspiratory movement followed by glottal closure.
sentences.chinese: 呃逆是一個簡短的自願吸氣運動其次是聲門關閉。

sentences.english: To analyse the diagnostic value of CT for glottic carcinoma.
sentences.chinese: 探討聲門型喉癌的CT診斷價值。

sentences.english: Air that is expelled from the lungs passes through the glottis.
sentences.chinese: 空氣從肺部輸出，首先通過聲門。

sentences.english: If the airway becomes distorted, releasing cricoid pressure may improve visualization of the glottis.
sentences.chinese: 若氣道扭曲，則應減少壓力以充分暴露聲門。

sentences.english: Objective To study the effects of impact parameters on the lung impact injury under closure of glottis in rabbits.
sentences.chinese: 目的研究撞擊參數對聲門緊閉狀態下肺撞擊傷的影響。

sentences.english: There were different phonetic hoarseness of glottic stenosis.
sentences.chinese: 聲門區狹窄有不同程度的發音嘶啞。

definition: location on wrist over the radial artery where pulse is taken in TCM
lit. to breathe out stale air and breathe in fresh (idiom, from Zhuangzi 庄子); fig. to get rid of the old and bring in the new
